data.torque: 617 or 651 N⋅m (455 or 480 lb⋅ft) at 6,700 rpm

summary: The BMW S70/2 engine is a naturally-aspirated, DOHC, V12 petrol engine used in the McLaren F1 from 1993 to 1998. It features a 60° V12 layout with displacements ranging from 5.6 L to 6.1 L. The engine has an aluminum block and head, with a compression ratio of 11:1 and a power output between 375 and 900 hp, depending on the variant. Its torque ranges from 406 to 664 lb-ft. In contrast, the earlier BMW M70 engine, produced from 1987 to 1994, is a SOHC V12 with a 5.0 L displacement, offering 295 hp and 332 lb-ft of torque. The S70/2 is a more powerful and advanced engine compared to the M70.
